com.microsoft.azure.datalake.store

Class RecursiveAclProcessor

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.microsoft.azure.datalake.store.RecursiveAclProcessor

  • public class RecursiveAclProcessor
extends Object
    Recursively modify ACLs of a directory tree. This class spawns many threads and applies the ACLs in parallel. Call the static method processRequest to do the work.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static RecursiveAclProcessorStats processRequest(com.microsoft.azure.datalake.store.ADLStoreClient client, String path, List<com.microsoft.azure.datalake.store.acl.AclEntry> aclSpec, AdlAclOperation op)
      Add ACLs recursively to a directory tree.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • processRequest

        public static RecursiveAclProcessorStats processRequest(com.microsoft.azure.datalake.store.ADLStoreClient client,
                                                        String path,
                                                        List<com.microsoft.azure.datalake.store.acl.AclEntry> aclSpec,
                                                        AdlAclOperation op)
                                                 throws IOException
        Add ACLs recursively to a directory tree.
        Parameters:
        client - ADLStoreClient object to use
        path - the root of the path to set ACLs for
        aclSpec - the ACL list to apply
        op - AdlAclOperation enum value specifying the operation to perform
        Returns:
        RecursiveAclProcessorStats object containing stats of the run
        Throws:
        IOException - throws IOException if there is an error
